description.plain:
Divine Ikubor (born 1 May 2000 in Benin City, Nigeria) is a Nigerian singer and songwriter better known as Rema.

Rema honed his singing and rapping skills as a youngster, and his musical career began in 2018 when he uploaded a short video of himself freestyling to D. Prince’s song, “Gucci Gang.” In 2019, D'Prince helped him sign to Jonzing World Records after hearing Rema’s freestyle. Rema intended to focus on hip-hop, but he explained how he got into Afrobeats in a Rolling Stone, interview, stating:

I was like, I had to prove myself. At that time, I had no Afrobeats songs—strictly hip-hop, strictly trap. D’Prince started pitching some Afrobeats to me, and I started vibing.

After signing to Jonzing World Records, Rema released his debut project on March 22, 2019, Rema. “Iron Man,” from the EP, was a commercial success and made the cut on Barrack Obama’s 2019 playlist, further increasing Rema’s fame. Rema recorded two more EPs, Freestyle and Bad Commando, which highlighted his versatility with tracks like “Lady” and “Boulevard.”

On March 25, 2022, Rema released his long-awaited debut album Rave & Roses with features from 6LACK, Chris Brown, AJ Tracey and Yseult. The album was a huge success thanks to songs such as “calm down” and “Soundgasm.”

Rema has a strong online presence as evidenced by the tremendous online reaction to his releases. His sexually charged songs and cultural presence have made him not just famous, but also one of Nigeria’s and the world’s most beloved artist.

Divine Ikubor (born 1 May 2000 in Benin City, Nigeria) is a Nigerian singer and songwriter better known as Rema.

Rema honed his singing and rapping skills as a youngster, and his musical career began in 2018 when he uploaded a short video of himself freestyling to D. Prince’s song, “Gucci Gang.” In 2019, D'Prince helped him sign to Jonzing World Records after hearing Rema’s freestyle. Rema intended to focus on hip-hop, but he explained how he got into Afrobeats in a Rolling Stone, interview, stating:

I was like, I had to prove myself. At that time, I had no Afrobeats songs—strictly hip-hop, strictly trap. D’Prince started pitching some Afrobeats to me, and I started vibing.

After signing to Jonzing World Records, Rema released his debut project on March 22, 2019, Rema. “Iron Man,” from the EP, was a commercial success and made the cut on Barrack Obama’s 2019 playlist, further increasing Rema’s fame. Rema recorded two more EPs, Freestyle and Bad Commando, which highlighted his versatility with tracks like “Lady” and “Boulevard.”

On March 25, 2022, Rema released his long-awaited debut album Rave & Roses with features from 6LACK, Chris Brown, AJ Tracey and Yseult. The album was a huge success thanks to songs such as “calm down” and “Soundgasm.”

Rema has a strong online presence as evidenced by the tremendous online reaction to his releases. His sexually charged songs and cultural presence have made him not just famous, but also one of Nigeria’s and the world’s most beloved artist.

songs.title: Calm Down

description.plain: “Calm Down” is a typical love song with a mid-tempo beat, released as the second single off Rave & Roses. Rema is attempting to communicate how much he loves a girl and how her love is driving him insane, which is typical. In this case, the singer’s persona—looking for a lady’s love interest. The difficulty here, though, is trust, which the lady believes Rema lacks. He also mentioned how different his significant other is from the other girls he has met.

songs.embed_content: Read “Calm Down” by Rema on Genius

songs.title: Dumebi

description.plain: “Dumebi”, is a song written by Rema. In this song,  his search for love leads him to an Afropop dance party bop with piano-led beats Ozedikus produces. In true Afropop fashion, Rema’s intention here is to provide a catchy groove for the dancefloor while his lyrics swing aimlessly between smug brags and his love interest’s attractive body.

songs.embed_content: Read “Dumebi” by Rema on Genius

songs.title: Woman

description.plain:
“Woman” servers as the 4th single from Rema. On the track, Rema embraces the thrills of having multiple interpersonal relationships with women.

“Woman” is a declaration of love to the female gender. Rema declares his flame to all women, telling them that he loves them madly regardless of their shapes and colors.
